stanza.line: How heavy do I journey on theway
When what I seek my weary travelend
Doth teach that case and that repose tosay
Thus far the miles are measured from thyfriend
The beast that bears me tired with mywoe
Plods dully on to bear that weight inme
As if by some instinct the wretch didknow
His rider loved not speed being made fromthee
The bloody spur cannot provoke him on
That sometimes anger thrusts into hishide
Which heavily he answers with a groan
More sharp to me than spurring to hisside
For that same groan doth put this in mymind
My grief lies onward and my joybehind
